availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Martin Rogers (Jefferson County, Kentucky, student and notary public)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, student and notary public. Fayette County, Kentucky, native. Son of B. F. Rogers and Mary Ann Coons Rogers Keyes. Married to Kate Gamble Rogers in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on December 17, 1863. Father of Bernard Rogers. Attended school in Fayette County in 1850. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Attended school in Jefferson County in 1860. Graduate of the University of Louisville in Jefferson County. Household owned thirty-three enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860. Lawyer in Jefferson County in 1861. Notary public in Jefferson County in 1861.

ab.bibl:

The Lexington Herald, March 16, 1863, https://www.newspapers.com/clip/78884578/.
